page.title: 05HYDE AND TEMPLE FARMS.
page.content: Hyde and Temple Farms are both owned by Mr. Randall, and were originally bought by his grandfather. Hyde Farm is an arable farm, growing wheat to make flour, barley for animal feed, and oilseed rape for making margarine. Oilseed rape is quite a new crop, and is bright yellow in colour. Temple Farm is a dairy farm. Most of the land is used to grow hay for the cows. The hay is turned into silage. When it is cut, it is piled up and covered with black plastic sheet. This pickles it, and it becomes very smelly, but the cows seem to like it. It is fed to them in the winter when they have to live in huge cowsheds, and cannot graze in the fields. The cows are milked in a herringbone milking parlour. They all have numbers not names, as there are so many of them.
